intro: Chamissoa altissima, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and showy, showy, pink to red flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that allow it to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, reducing water loss through transpiration. Chamissoa altissima blooms in spring, adding vibrant color to desert landscapes.
